thread.title_full: Yahoo says Marissa Mayer will leave board after Verizon deal closes, will operate under new name Altaba

author: Ken Yeung
title: Yahoo says Marissa Mayer will leave board after Verizon deal closes, will operate under new name Altaba
text:
Yahoo chief executive Marissa Mayer will be resigning from the board after her company completes its acquisition by Verizon. She is not the only one to depart from the combined company, as David Filo, Eddy Hartenstein, Richard Hill, Jane Shaw, and Maynard Webb will be leaving. Eric Brandt will become the chairman of the board.
In other news, the holding company of Yahoo’s core assets will become known as Altaba, Inc.
Verizon won the rights to Yahoo last year, paying $4.8 billion for the company, but it wasn’t exactly a seamless process.
This is developing. Please refresh for updates.
